de.unisb.cs.st.javaslicer.controlflowanalysis

Class ControlFlowGraph

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.unisb.cs.st.javaslicer.controlflowanalysis.ControlFlowGraph
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    de.hammacher.util.graph.Graph<ControlFlowGraph.InstrNode>

    public class ControlFlowGraph
extends Object
implements de.hammacher.util.graph.Graph<ControlFlowGraph.InstrNode>
    A representation of the control flow graph (CFG) for one method.
    Author:
    Clemens Hammacher

      • ControlFlowGraph

        public ControlFlowGraph(de.unisb.cs.st.javaslicer.common.classRepresentation.ReadMethod method)
        Computes the control flow graph for one method, using the usual ControlFlowGraph.AbstractNodeFactory.
        Parameters:

      • ControlFlowGraph

        public ControlFlowGraph(de.unisb.cs.st.javaslicer.common.classRepresentation.ReadMethod method,
                ControlFlowGraph.NodeFactory nodeFactory)
        Computes the control flow graph for one method.
        Parameters:

        nodeFactory - the factory that creates the nodes of the CFG

      • ControlFlowGraph

        public ControlFlowGraph(de.unisb.cs.st.javaslicer.common.classRepresentation.ReadMethod method,
                ControlFlowGraph.NodeFactory nodeFactory,
                boolean addTryCatchEdges,
                boolean excludeLabels)
        Computes the control flow graph for one method.
        Parameters:
        method - the method for which the CFG is computed
        nodeFactory - the factory that creates the nodes of the CFG
        addTryCatchEdges - controls whether an edge should be inserted from each instruction within a try block to the first instruction in the catch block
        excludeLabels - if true, all Labels and goto instruction are excluded from the CFG

    • Method Detail

      • getRootNode

        public ControlFlowGraph.InstrNode getRootNode()
        Returns the root of this CFG, which is just the Node corresponding to the first instruction of this CFG's method, or null if the method contains no instructions. If the CFG was created with excludeLabels and the first instruction is a label, then the node for the first non-label instruction is returned.

      • getMethod

        public de.unisb.cs.st.javaslicer.common.classRepresentation.ReadMethod getMethod()
        Returns the method on which this CFG was built.
        Returns:
        the method on which this CFG was built.

      • getNode

        public ControlFlowGraph.InstrNode getNode(de.unisb.cs.st.javaslicer.common.classRepresentation.Instruction instr)
        Return the node of the CFG associated to the given Instruction. If the instruction is not contained in the method that this CFG corresponds to, then null is returned. If the CFG was created with excludeLabels and the given instruction is a label, then the node for the next non-label instruction is returned.
        Parameters:
        instr - the Instruction for which the node is requested
        Returns:
        the node corresponding to the given Instruction, or null if the instruction is not contained in the method of this CFG

      • getInstrNode
